svg.content: <mxfile host="app.diagrams.net" modified="2022-08-30T12:47:49.596Z" agent="5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/103.0.0.0 Safari/537.36" version="20.2.7" etag="CkSEfQF4fC7y04-psXYm" type="google"><diagram id="L5jNr3qqQCdlVHSogWoA"></diagram></mxfile>

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe flex-start; width: 828px; height: 1px; padding-top: 768px; margin-left: 2px;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; overflow-wrap: normal;

font.font:
= β1*Vk + α * ∇Wk
Wk+1 = Wk - Vk+1
1. Dampens inconsistent oscillation in direction of high curvature
2. Builds up speed in direction of consistent gradient.
3. Requires sqrt(R) times fewer iteration than SGD , where R is the condition no of the curvature. For β = (1-R)/(1+R).
Typical value of β1 = 0.9 ; α needs to be tuned.
font.span: Acts like momentum with a correction that, it calculates gradient for
is roughly an approximation of Wk+1.

So it tries to look ahead and calculates gradient for that weight (~Wk+1). Thus it takes a more secure/corrected step considering future value of the current weight. It is fatster O(1/T) than SGD O(1/T2)

sub.font:
If consecutive two minibatches have same sign for gradient only then update that gradient.
RMSProp

b.style: font-size: 12px ; color: rgb(32 , 33 , 36) ; font-family: "arial" , sans-serif ; background-color: rgb(255 , 255 , 255)

span.span: Inconsistent gradients have greater magnitudes, which appears with alternating direction (+/-) for consecutive iterations. This happens due to moving from one side to another of a local minima at high curvature surface.
Bigger gradient values are divided by big accumulated value i.e. sqrt( Z).
ε to avoid division by zero, doesn't need tuning normally.

font.span:
needs to be tuned.
Adam
It is a combination of momentum and RMSProp. The name Adam : Adaptive approximation of Moment. Because it uses first and second moment of gradients to correct rate of learning for each gradient. Nth moment of x is

b.style: color: rgb(32 , 33 , 36) ; font-family: "arial" , sans-serif ; background-color: rgb(255 , 255 , 255)
